New Records: The Oklahoma City Thunder won their 14th straight game, tying the longest winning streak in franchise history set in the 1995-96 season by the Seattle Supersonics.
Key Match Events: The Thunder overcame an 8-point deficit with a 12-3 run led by Aaron Wiggins' crucial fourth-quarter performance.
Wiggins scored 15 of his 19 points in the fourth quarter, including key moments that shifted momentum in the game.
Pre-Game Insights: The Thunder entered the game with a 29-5 season record, while the Knicks were at 24-11.
Post-Match Reflections: The Thunder's win extended their season record to 29-5, while the Knicks dropped to 24-11.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was significant as it tied the longest winning streak in franchise history.
